body: Senator and GOP presidential contender Marco Rubio (R-Fla.) on May 15, 2015, in Athens, Ga. (David Goldman/AP)  EXETER, N.H. — Sen. Marco Rubio (R-Fla.) is cool with a 2016 presidential ticket that includes him and rival Scott Walker — as long as he is on top. "A Walker-Rubio ticket may be fine, but it's got to be in alphabetical order," Rubio told reporters here in response to a Washington Post reporter's question. [Walker-Rubio 2016? Walker says his supporters love the idea] Walker has talking up the possibility of a Walker-Rubio ticket, saying supporters have showed great interest in the idea.

title: Rubio: Walker-Rubio ticket must go in ‘alphabetical order’
